ngiemboon: Á laa na ngùʼ mbɔ́ɔntè ntsɔ̀b wémɔʼɔ́ páʼ mé la lɔg pà Ésàlayɛ ńgʉa, pɔ́ cʉ́ʼ megàŋatsaŋá ncù, á gwɔ́ na ndùŋmvfò lyɛ̌ʼ na saŋ tá, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn né mèŋ ngie:
en: In the eleventh year,   in the third month, on the first day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me:

ngiemboon: «Gù míŋ nyìŋ mesoŋ, júʼu mmó gie ɔ̀ ge zɛ́te mbwó Falahoŋ fùɔ pa Egíbtò, mbɔɔ mbwó nùɔ láʼ gie à sáʼa; ɔ̀ ge zɛ́te yé ngie:
en: “Son of man, say to Pharaoh king of Egypt and to his hordes,

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ sẅé tsɔ́ tÿǒ Sɛ́ɛndèle gie áa ngwòŋ Limbaŋ
en: Think of Assyria, a cedar in Lebanon,
The waters caused it to grow;

ngiemboon: Á zẅɛ́ʼ, ńjÿó pì páʼ mɛ̌ mentse la lɔg ńgyɔ́ɔn,
en: Therefore the cedar became greater in height

ngiemboon: Meshʉ̌ŋ mentí ntsèm tóo ḿbáʼa menkʉ̀a mɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ mbwó mé,
en: All the birds of the sky

ngiemboon: Á laa tÿǒ ḿbú sí tɛʼ,
en: It was beautiful in its size,
The cedars in God’s garden could not eclipse it;

ngiemboon: N da ná menkʉ̀ʼʉ mbwó tÿǒ né yé,
en: I made it beautiful with its many limbs,

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, júʼu mmó gie mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé gɔɔn: Atÿǒ Sɛ́ɛndèle ka gǔʼ, ńkwɔ́ʼ ńgʉa tÿǒ tà ńkíbe melɔ́ɔn, ńcʉ́ʼʉ ngàŋa ŋáʼtè.
en: “ ‘Therefore, this is what the Lord God says: Since it   towered high in stature and set its top among the clouds, and it  # 31:10 Lit its heart grew proud  # 31:10 Ezk 28:17; Dn 5:20 on account of its height,

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á ka gÿo, n gwáʼa yé, ńnéŋe yé na mbwó fùɔ gẅie aa ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ ḿbú ńgẅiin tʉ̀, á gẅie à ge záb ngɔ́ʼ twó yé, páʼ ngÿǒ menò mé ne ńzɛ́te.
en: I determined to hand it over to a ruler of nations;   he would surely deal with it. I banished it because of its wickedness.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ meláʼa ndyɛ̀ʼɛ, ńgwɔ́ ngàŋatág ńcʉa petsɔ́, é kɔʼɔ́ yé ńgwá. Mbwó mé gwete tsɛ̀ɛ mekwɛ́, mbɔɔ jʉʼ ntsèm tsɛ̀ɛ fúʼ. Meyáŋ mé ka gwete tsɛ̀ɛ menkʉŋé mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ, ḿbwɔ́ʼte; epʉ̀a metsèm pie é tsẅé ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ fó na jʉ́jʉ́ŋ we ńkÿo, ńgwáʼa yé.
en: Foreigners, ruthless men from the nations,   cut it down and left it lying. Its limbs fell on the mountains and in every valley; its boughs lay broken in all the earth’s ravines. All the peoples of the earth left its shade and abandoned it.

ngiemboon: Meshʉ̌ŋ mentí mentí tóo ńnéŋte na tÿǒ ŋwɛ́ gie mé ka kɔ̌ʼ, menɔ̀ɔn pie ée mbàʼ ntsèm é tóo ńtsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ mbwó mé.
en: All the birds of the sky nested on its fallen trunk, and all the animals of the field were among its boughs.

ngiemboon: Á la gwɔ́ púʼu, légwɔ́ gie atsɔ́ tÿǒ gie mé ge pfɛte né ntse, tà á gíŋ ḿbú ńgẅiin ntse na menŋaŋ mé, tá tÿǒ gʉ́m ké le kúʼu lékwɔ́ʼ ńgʉa tÿǒ tà ńkíbe melɔ́ɔn wɔ́, á ké le ŋáʼte nnɛ́ wɔ́, á zɔɔn ńgwaa wɔ́, anò ye metÿǒ gíŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ ye pʉ̀a mesoŋ pie é gẅiin lékwé, ńgẅiin lémaga ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, ńgʉa ńkẅɛ́te pʉ̀a pie é la vɔg ńgʉa ńnuŋe nzèm ssé.
en: This happened so that no trees planted beside water would become great in height and set their tops among the clouds, and so that no other well-watered trees would reach them in height. For they have all been consigned to death, to the underworld, among the people   who descend to the Pit.  # 31:14 Ezk 26:20

ngiemboon: Mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé, n ne ńgɔɔn ngie: Á laa lyɛ̌ʼ gie atÿǒ Sɛ́ɛndèle la gʉa né láʼ mepfó, n da gÿo njÿó kaa legwé. N kúʼte mentse nzèm ssé tsetsáʼ, ńgÿo é té gíŋ ńcwóŋ wɔ́, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo, é pʉ́le ńtyé na melǎŋ mé mie é gyɔ́ɔn. N ka gÿo nzěm pú ńkábte mekwɛ́ mie ée ngwòŋ Limbaŋ, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo metÿǒ mie ée membʉ̀a láʼ, é pú ńjúm, ńtí yé.
en: “ ‘This is what the Lord God says: I caused grieving on the day the cedar went down to Sheol.   I closed off the underground deep because of it:  # 31:15 Or I covered it with the underground deep I held back the rivers of the deep, and its abundant water was restrained. I made Lebanon mourn on account of it, and all the trees of the field fainted because of it.

ngiemboon: N da gwɔ́ tà ńkɔ́ʼɔ tÿǒ ŋwɛ́, légwɔ́ gie á ge sẅɛ́ʼ, é gʉa né láʼ mepfó, meláʼa meláʼ júʼ páʼ á gwě, ecÿɔʼ gwoon wɔ́b, pɔ́ vɛ. Á gwɔ́ láʼ mepfó, metÿǒ ntsèm mie ée Éndɛ̀n, metÿǒ mie é pú sí, lâ mie ntse ée na menŋaŋ mé á ngwòŋ Limbaŋ, é pú ńgẅiin lekág.
en: I made the nations quake at the sound of its downfall, when I threw it down to Sheol to be with those who descend to the Pit. Then all the trees of Eden,   the choice and best of Lebanon, all the well-watered trees, were comforted  # 31:16 Ezk 32:31 in the underworld.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ yɔ́b la pú ḿmaga ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ pâ pʉ̀a pie ncù la zẅéte wɔ́b, á wɔ́b gẅie pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńtóonte yé, ḿbiŋe ńtsẅé jʉʼʉ sẅisẅê ye á tsetsɛ̀ɛ metsɔ́ meláʼ.
en: They too descended with it to Sheol, to those slain by the sword. As its allies  ,# 31:17 Lit arm they had lived in its shade among the nations.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ́ tÿǒ te tsɛ̀ɛ nkáʼ Éndɛ̀n gie á sí ḿbiŋ fáŋ páʼ gù wɔ́. Tà mbɔɔ púʼu, mé ge pú tsó gẅí lâ pɔ̌ é maʼa ssé, pi lâ pʉ̀a pie mé la te wɔ́b púʼ lâ pʉ̀a pie ncù la zẅéte wɔ́b, e púte ńnuŋe. Wɛ̂ aa páʼ anò ye Falahoŋ lâ pʉ̀a pé ge láʼ gwɔ́. Mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé zɔ gɔɔn.»
en: “ ‘Who then are you like in glory and greatness among Eden’s trees? You also will be brought down to the underworld to be with the trees of Eden. You will lie among the uncircumcised with those slain by the sword.   This is Pharaoh and all his hordes. This is the declaration of the Lord God.’ ”
